title.raw: 《燕召公世家》 House of Yan Shaogong

sentences.zh: 召公奭與周同姓，姓姬氏。

translations.literal: Duke Shao Shi same surname as Zhou, surname Ji clan.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Shao Shi had the same surname as Zhou, the Ji clan.
translations.text: The Duke of Shao Shi had the same surname as Zhou, the Ji clan.

sentences.zh: 周武王之滅紂，封召公於北燕。

translations.literal: Zhou Wu Wang when extinguished Zhou, enfeoffed Duke Shao at northern Yan.
translations.idiomatic: When King Wu of Zhou extinguished Zhou, he enfeoffed the Duke of Shao at northern Yan.
translations.text: When King Wu of Zhou extinguished Zhou, he enfeoffed the Duke of Shao at northern Yan.

sentences.zh: 其在成王時，召王為三公：自陜以西，召公主之；

translations.literal: In Cheng Wang time, Duke Shao became three dukes: from Shan west, Duke Shao governed it;
translations.idiomatic: In King Cheng's time, the Duke of Shao became one of the three dukes: west of Shan, the Duke of Shao governed it;
translations.text: In King Cheng's time, the Duke of Shao became one of the three dukes: west of Shan, the Duke of Shao governed it;

sentences.zh: 自陜以東，周公主之。

translations.literal: From Shan east, Zhou Gong governed it.
translations.idiomatic: East of Shan, the Duke of Zhou governed it.
translations.text: East of Shan, the Duke of Zhou governed it.

sentences.zh: 成王既幼，周公攝政，當國踐祚，召公疑之，作君奭。

translations.literal: Cheng Wang already young, Zhou Gong acted as regent, handled state ascended throne, Duke Shao doubted it, made Jun Shi.
translations.idiomatic: King Cheng was already young, and the Duke of Zhou acted as regent, handling the state and ascending the throne. The Duke of Shao doubted this and composed 'Jun Shi.'
translations.text: King Cheng was already young, and the Duke of Zhou acted as regent, handling the state and ascending the throne. The Duke of Shao doubted this and composed 'Jun Shi.'

sentences.zh: 君奭不說周公。

translations.literal: Jun Shi not pleased Zhou Gong.
translations.idiomatic: 'Jun Shi' was not pleased with the Duke of Zhou.
translations.text: 'Jun Shi' was not pleased with the Duke of Zhou.

sentences.zh: 周公乃稱「湯時有伊尹，假于皇天；

translations.literal: Zhou Gong then said 'Tang time had Yi Yin, assisted by August Heaven;
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Zhou then said: 'In Tang's time there was Yi Yin, assisted by August Heaven;
translations.text: The Duke of Zhou then said: 'In Tang's time there was Yi Yin, assisted by August Heaven;

sentences.zh: 在太戊時，則有若伊陟、臣扈，假于上帝，巫咸治王家；

translations.literal: In Tai Wu time, then had like Yi Zhi, Chen Hu, assisted by Shang Di, Wu Xian governed wang family;
translations.idiomatic: In Tai Wu's time, there were Yi Zhi and Chen Hu, assisted by Shang Di, and Wu Xian governed the royal family;
translations.text: In Tai Wu's time, there were Yi Zhi and Chen Hu, assisted by Shang Di, and Wu Xian governed the royal family;

sentences.zh: 在祖乙時，則有若巫賢；

translations.literal: In Zu Yi time, then had like Wu Xian;
translations.idiomatic: In Zu Yi's time, there was Wu Xian;
translations.text: In Zu Yi's time, there was Wu Xian;

sentences.zh: 在武丁時，則有若甘般：率維茲有陳，保乂有殷」。

translations.literal: In Wu Ding time, then had like Gan Pan: followed only this had arranged, protected righteousness had Yin.'
translations.idiomatic: In Wu Ding's time, there was Gan Pan: he followed and arranged this properly, protecting righteousness for Yin.'
translations.text: In Wu Ding's time, there was Gan Pan: he followed and arranged this properly, protecting righteousness for Yin.'

sentences.zh: 於是召公乃說。

translations.literal: Therefore Duke Shao then pleased.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore the Duke of Shao was then pleased.
translations.text: Therefore the Duke of Shao was then pleased.

sentences.zh: 召公之治西方，甚得兆民和。

translations.literal: Duke Shao's governing western, very obtained myriad people harmony.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Shao's governance of the west very much obtained harmony with the myriad people.
translations.text: The Duke of Shao's governance of the west very much obtained harmony with the myriad people.

sentences.zh: 召公巡行鄉邑，有棠樹，決獄政事其下，自侯伯至庶人各得其所，無失職者。

translations.literal: Duke Shao toured villages cities, had sweet棠 tree, decided cases administered affairs below it, from marquises counts to commoners each obtained their place, no lost position.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Shao toured the villages and cities. There was a crabapple tree under which he decided cases and administered affairs. From marquises and counts to commoners, each obtained their proper place, with none losing their position.
translations.text: The Duke of Shao toured the villages and cities. There was a crabapple tree under which he decided cases and administered affairs. From marquises and counts to commoners, each obtained their proper place, with none losing their position.

sentences.zh: 召公卒，而民人思召公之政，懷棠樹不敢伐，哥詠之，作甘棠之詩。

translations.literal: Duke Shao died, and people thought of Duke Shao's governance, cherished sweet棠 tree dared not cut, sang chanted it, made Sweet棠 poem.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Shao died, and the people thought of the Duke of Shao's governance. They cherished the crabapple tree and dared not cut it down. They sang and chanted about it, composing the 'Sweet Crabapple' poem.
translations.text: The Duke of Shao died, and the people thought of the Duke of Shao's governance. They cherished the crabapple tree and dared not cut it down. They sang and chanted about it, composing the 'Sweet Crabapple' poem.

sentences.zh: 自召公已下九世至惠侯。

translations.literal: From Duke Shao below nine generations to Hui Hou.
translations.idiomatic: From the Duke of Shao down nine generations to Duke Hui.
translations.text: From the Duke of Shao down nine generations to Duke Hui.

sentences.zh: 燕惠侯當周厲王奔彘，共和之時。

translations.literal: Yan Hui Hou during Zhou Li Wang fled Zhi, Gong He time.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Hui of Yan was during the time when King Li of Zhou fled to Zhi, and the Gong He period.
translations.text: Duke Hui of Yan was during the time when King Li of Zhou fled to Zhi, and the Gong He period.

sentences.zh: 惠侯卒，子釐侯立。

translations.literal: Hui Hou died, son Xi Hou ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Hui died, and his son Duke Xi ascended.
translations.text: Duke Hui died, and his son Duke Xi ascended.

sentences.zh: 是歲，周宣王初即位。

translations.literal: This year, Zhou Xuan Wang first ascended throne.
translations.idiomatic: In this year, King Xuan of Zhou first ascended the throne.
translations.text: In this year, King Xuan of Zhou first ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 釐侯二十一年，鄭桓公初封於鄭。

translations.literal: Xi Hou twenty-first year, Zheng Huan Gong initially enfeoffed at Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xi's twenty-first year, Duke Huan of Zheng was initially enfeoffed at Zheng.
translations.text: In Duke Xi's twenty-first year, Duke Huan of Zheng was initially enfeoffed at Zheng.

sentences.zh: 三十六年，釐侯卒，子頃侯立。

translations.literal: Thirty-sixth year, Xi Hou died, son Qing Hou ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-sixth year, Duke Xi died, and his son Duke Qing ascended.
translations.text: In the thirty-sixth year, Duke Xi died, and his son Duke Qing ascended.

sentences.zh: 頃侯二十年，周幽王淫亂，為犬戎所弒。

translations.literal: Qing Hou twentieth year, Zhou You Wang licentious chaotic, by Quan Rong assassinated.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Qing's twentieth year, King You of Zhou was licentious and chaotic, and was assassinated by the Quan Rong.
translations.text: In Duke Qing's twentieth year, King You of Zhou was licentious and chaotic, and was assassinated by the Quan Rong.

sentences.zh: 秦始列為諸侯。

translations.literal: Qin began ranked as feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Qin began to be ranked as feudal lords.
translations.text: Qin began to be ranked as feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，頃侯卒，子哀侯立。

translations.literal: Twenty-fourth year, Qing Hou died, son Ai Hou ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, Duke Qing died, and his son Duke Ai ascended.
translations.text: In the twenty-fourth year, Duke Qing died, and his son Duke Ai ascended.

sentences.zh: 哀侯二年卒，子鄭侯立。

translations.literal: Ai Hou second year died, son Zheng Hou ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ai died in his second year, and his son Duke Zheng ascended.
translations.text: Duke Ai died in his second year, and his son Duke Zheng ascended.

sentences.zh: 鄭侯三十六年卒，子繆侯立。

translations.literal: Zheng Hou thirty-sixth year died, son Mu Hou ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zheng died in his thirty-sixth year, and his son Duke Mu ascended.
translations.text: Duke Zheng died in his thirty-sixth year, and his son Duke Mu ascended.

sentences.zh: 繆侯七年，而魯隱公元年也。

translations.literal: Mu Hou seventh year, and Lu Yin Gong first year.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu's seventh year was also Duke Yin's first year in Lu.
translations.text: Duke Mu's seventh year was also Duke Yin's first year in Lu.

sentences.zh: 十八年卒，子宣侯立。

translations.literal: Eighteenth year died, son Xuan Hou ascended.
translations.idiomatic: He died in the eighteenth year, and his son Duke Xuan ascended.
translations.text: He died in the eighteenth year, and his son Duke Xuan ascended.

sentences.zh: 宣侯十三年卒，子桓侯立。

translations.literal: Xuan Hou thirteenth year died, son Huan Hou ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xuan died in his thirteenth year, and his son Duke Huan ascended.
translations.text: Duke Xuan died in his thirteenth year, and his son Duke Huan ascended.

sentences.zh: 桓侯七年卒，子莊公立。

translations.literal: Huan Hou seventh year died, son Zhuang Gong ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan died in his seventh year, and his son Duke Zhuang ascended.
translations.text: Duke Huan died in his seventh year, and his son Duke Zhuang ascended.

sentences.zh: 莊公十二年，齊桓公始霸。

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong twelfth year, Qi Huan Gong began hegemony.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Zhuang's twelfth year, Duke Huan of Qi began his hegemony.
translations.text: In Duke Zhuang's twelfth year, Duke Huan of Qi began his hegemony.

sentences.zh: 十六年，與宋、衛共伐周惠王，惠王出奔溫，立惠王弟穨為周王。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year, with Song, Wei together attacked Zhou Hui Wang, Hui Wang fled to Wen, established Hui Wang younger brother Sui as Zhou Wang.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, together with Song and Wei, they attacked King Hui of Zhou. King Hui fled to Wen, and they established King Hui's younger brother Sui as King of Zhou.
translations.text: In the sixteenth year, together with Song and Wei, they attacked King Hui of Zhou. King Hui fled to Wen, and they established King Hui's younger brother Sui as King of Zhou.

sentences.zh: 十七年，鄭執燕仲父而內惠王于周。

translations.literal: Seventeenth year, Zheng seized Yan Zhong Fu and installed Hui Wang in Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, Zheng seized Yan Zhong Fu and installed King Hui in Zhou.
translations.text: In the seventeenth year, Zheng seized Yan Zhong Fu and installed King Hui in Zhou.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，山戎來侵我，齊桓公救燕，遂北伐山戎而還。

translations.literal: Twenty-seventh year, Shan Rong came invaded us, Qi Huan Gong saved Yan, then north attacked Shan Rong and returned.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, the Shan Rong came to invade us. Duke Huan of Qi saved Yan, then attacked north against the Shan Rong and returned.
translations.text: In the twenty-seventh year, the Shan Rong came to invade us. Duke Huan of Qi saved Yan, then attacked north against the Shan Rong and returned.

sentences.zh: 燕君送齊桓公出境，桓公因割燕所至地予燕，使燕共貢天子，如成周時職；

translations.literal: Yan ruler sent Qi Huan Gong out border, Huan Gong therefore cut Yan what reached land gave Yan, made Yan together tribute Son of Heaven, like Cheng Zhou time duty;
translations.idiomatic: The Yan ruler sent Duke Huan of Qi out of the border. Duke Huan therefore cut off the land Yan had reached and gave it to Yan, making Yan together tribute the Son of Heaven, like the duty in Cheng Zhou times;
translations.text: The Yan ruler sent Duke Huan of Qi out of the border. Duke Huan therefore cut off the land Yan had reached and gave it to Yan, making Yan together tribute the Son of Heaven, like the duty in Cheng Zhou times;

sentences.zh: 使燕復修召公之法。

translations.literal: Made Yan again repair Duke Shao's methods.
translations.idiomatic: He made Yan again repair the Duke of Shao's methods.
translations.text: He made Yan again repair the Duke of Shao's methods.

sentences.zh: 三十三年卒，子襄公立。

translations.literal: Thirty-third year died, son Xiang Gong ascended.
translations.idiomatic: He died in the thirty-third year, and his son Duke Xiang ascended.
translations.text: He died in the thirty-third year, and his son Duke Xiang ascended.

sentences.zh: 襄公二十六年，晉文公為踐土之會，稱伯。

translations.literal: Xiang Gong twenty-sixth year, Jin Wen Gong made Jian Tu assembly, called Bo.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xiang's twenty-sixth year, Duke Wen of Jin held the Jian Tu assembly and was called Bo.
translations.text: In Duke Xiang's twenty-sixth year, Duke Wen of Jin held the Jian Tu assembly and was called Bo.

sentences.zh: 三十一年，秦師敗于殽。

translations.literal: Thirty-first year, Qin troops defeated at Xiao.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-first year, Qin troops were defeated at Xiao.
translations.text: In the thirty-first year, Qin troops were defeated at Xiao.

sentences.zh: 三十七年，秦穆公卒。

translations.literal: Thirty-seventh year, Qin Mu Gong died.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-seventh year, Duke Mu of Qin died.
translations.text: In the thirty-seventh year, Duke Mu of Qin died.

sentences.zh: 四十年，襄公卒，桓公立。

translations.literal: Fortieth year, Xiang Gong died, Huan Gong ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the fortieth year, Duke Xiang died, and Duke Huan ascended.
translations.text: In the fortieth year, Duke Xiang died, and Duke Huan ascended.

sentences.zh: 桓公十六年卒，宣公立。

translations.literal: Huan Gong sixteenth year died, Xuan Gong ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan died in his sixteenth year, and Duke Xuan ascended.
translations.text: Duke Huan died in his sixteenth year, and Duke Xuan ascended.

sentences.zh: 宣公十五年卒，昭公立。

translations.literal: Xuan Gong fifteenth year died, Zhao Gong ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xuan died in his fifteenth year, and Duke Zhao ascended.
translations.text: Duke Xuan died in his fifteenth year, and Duke Zhao ascended.

sentences.zh: 昭公十三年卒，武公立。

translations.literal: Zhao Gong thirteenth year died, Wu Gong ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Zhao died in his thirteenth year, and Duke Wu ascended.
translations.text: Duke Zhao died in his thirteenth year, and Duke Wu ascended.

sentences.zh: 是歲晉滅三郤大夫。

translations.literal: This year Jin extinguished three Xi grand officers.
translations.idiomatic: In this year, Jin extinguished the three Xi grand officers.
translations.text: In this year, Jin extinguished the three Xi grand officers.

sentences.zh: 武公十九年卒，文公立。

translations.literal: Wu Gong nineteenth year died, Wen Gong ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wu died in his nineteenth year, and Duke Wen ascended.
translations.text: Duke Wu died in his nineteenth year, and Duke Wen ascended.

sentences.zh: 文公六年卒，懿公立。

translations.literal: Wen Gong sixth year died, Yi Gong ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wen died in his sixth year, and Duke Yi ascended.
translations.text: Duke Wen died in his sixth year, and Duke Yi ascended.

sentences.zh: 懿公元年，齊崔杼弒其君莊公。

translations.literal: Yi Gong first year, Qi Cui Zhu assassinated their lord Zhuang Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Yi's first year, Qi's Cui Zhu assassinated their lord Duke Zhuang.
translations.text: In Duke Yi's first year, Qi's Cui Zhu assassinated their lord Duke Zhuang.

sentences.zh: 四年卒，子惠公立。

translations.literal: Fourth year died, son Hui Gong ascended.
translations.idiomatic: He died in the fourth year, and his son Duke Hui ascended.
translations.text: He died in the fourth year, and his son Duke Hui ascended.

sentences.zh: 惠公元年，齊高止來奔。

translations.literal: Hui Gong first year, Qi Gao Zhi came fleeing.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Hui's first year, Qi's Gao Zhi came fleeing.
translations.text: In Duke Hui's first year, Qi's Gao Zhi came fleeing.

sentences.zh: 六年，惠公多寵姬，公欲去諸大夫而立寵姬宋，大夫共誅姬宋，惠公懼，奔齊。

translations.literal: Sixth year, Hui Gong much favored concubines, gong desired remove various grand officers and establish favored concubine Song, grand officers together executed concubine Song, Hui Gong feared, fled Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Duke Hui much favored concubines. The duke desired to remove the various grand officers and establish his favored concubine Song. The grand officers together executed concubine Song. Duke Hui feared and fled to Qi.
translations.text: In the sixth year, Duke Hui much favored concubines. The duke desired to remove the various grand officers and establish his favored concubine Song. The grand officers together executed concubine Song. Duke Hui feared and fled to Qi.

sentences.zh: 四年，齊高偃如晉，請共伐燕，入其君。

translations.literal: Fourth year, Qi Gao Yan went to Jin, requested together attack Yan, install their lord.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Qi's Gao Yan went to Jin and requested they together attack Yan and install their lord.
translations.text: In the fourth year, Qi's Gao Yan went to Jin and requested they together attack Yan and install their lord.

sentences.zh: 晉平公許，與齊伐燕，入惠公。

translations.literal: Jin Ping Gong permitted, with Qi attacked Yan, installed Hui Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ping of Jin permitted it, and together with Qi attacked Yan and installed Duke Hui.
translations.text: Duke Ping of Jin permitted it, and together with Qi attacked Yan and installed Duke Hui.

sentences.zh: 惠公至燕而死。

translations.literal: Hui Gong arrived Yan and died.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Hui arrived in Yan and died.
translations.text: Duke Hui arrived in Yan and died.

sentences.zh: 燕立悼公。

translations.literal: Yan established Dao Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Yan established Duke Dao.
translations.text: Yan established Duke Dao.

sentences.zh: 悼公七年卒，共公立。

translations.literal: Dao Gong seventh year died, Gong Gong ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Dao died in his seventh year, and Duke Gong ascended.
translations.text: Duke Dao died in his seventh year, and Duke Gong ascended.

sentences.zh: 共公五年卒，平公立。

translations.literal: Gong Gong fifth year died, Ping Gong ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Gong died in his fifth year, and Duke Ping ascended.
translations.text: Duke Gong died in his fifth year, and Duke Ping ascended.

sentences.zh: 晉公室卑，六卿始彊大。

translations.literal: Jin ducal chamber lowly, six ministers began strong great.
translations.idiomatic: Jin's ducal chamber was lowly, and the six ministers began to grow strong and great.
translations.text: Jin's ducal chamber was lowly, and the six ministers began to grow strong and great.

sentences.zh: 平公十八年，吳王闔閭破楚入郢。

translations.literal: Ping Gong eighteenth year, Wu Wang He Lu broke Chu entered Ying.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Ping's eighteenth year, King He Lu of Wu broke Chu and entered Ying.
translations.text: In Duke Ping's eighteenth year, King He Lu of Wu broke Chu and entered Ying.

sentences.zh: 十九年卒，簡公立。

translations.literal: Nineteenth year died, Jian Gong ascended.
translations.idiomatic: He died in the nineteenth year, and Duke Jian ascended.
translations.text: He died in the nineteenth year, and Duke Jian ascended.

sentences.zh: 簡公十二年卒，獻公立。

translations.literal: Jian Gong twelfth year died, Xian Gong ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jian died in his twelfth year, and Duke Xian ascended.
translations.text: Duke Jian died in his twelfth year, and Duke Xian ascended.

sentences.zh: 晉趙鞅圍范、中行於朝歌。

translations.literal: Jin Zhao Yang surrounded Fan, Zhong Xing at Zhao Ge.
translations.idiomatic: Jin's Zhao Yang surrounded Fan and Zhong Xing at Zhao Ge.
translations.text: Jin's Zhao Yang surrounded Fan and Zhong Xing at Zhao Ge.

sentences.zh: 獻公十二年，齊田常弒其君簡公。

translations.literal: Xian Gong twelfth year, Qi Tian Chang assassinated their lord Jian Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xian's twelfth year, Qi's Tian Chang assassinated their lord Duke Jian.
translations.text: In Duke Xian's twelfth year, Qi's Tian Chang assassinated their lord Duke Jian.

sentences.zh: 十四年，孔子卒。

translations.literal: Fourteenth year, Kong Qiu died.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, Kong Qiu died.
translations.text: In the fourteenth year, Kong Qiu died.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，獻公卒，孝公立。

translations.literal: Twenty-eighth year, Xian Gong died, Xiao Gong ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, Duke Xian died, and Duke Xiao ascended.
translations.text: In the twenty-eighth year, Duke Xian died, and Duke Xiao ascended.

sentences.zh: 孝公十二年，韓、魏、趙滅知伯，分其地，三晉彊。

translations.literal: Xiao Gong twelfth year, Han, Wei, Zhao extinguished Zhi Bo, divided his land, three Jin strong.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xiao's twelfth year, Han, Wei, and Zhao extinguished Zhi Bo, divided his land, and the three Jin grew strong.
translations.text: In Duke Xiao's twelfth year, Han, Wei, and Zhao extinguished Zhi Bo, divided his land, and the three Jin grew strong.

sentences.zh: 十五年，孝公卒，成公立。

translations.literal: Fifteenth year, Xiao Gong died, Cheng Gong ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, Duke Xiao died, and Duke Cheng ascended.
translations.text: In the fifteenth year, Duke Xiao died, and Duke Cheng ascended.

sentences.zh: 成公十六年卒，湣公立。

translations.literal: Cheng Gong sixteenth year died, Min Gong ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Cheng died in his sixteenth year, and Duke Min ascended.
translations.text: Duke Cheng died in his sixteenth year, and Duke Min ascended.

sentences.zh: 湣公三十一年卒，釐公立。

translations.literal: Min Gong thirty-first year died, Xi Gong ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Min died in his thirty-first year, and Duke Xi ascended.
translations.text: Duke Min died in his thirty-first year, and Duke Xi ascended.

sentences.zh: 是歲，三晉列為諸侯。

translations.literal: This year, three Jin ranked as feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: In this year, the three Jin were ranked as feudal lords.
translations.text: In this year, the three Jin were ranked as feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 釐公三十年，伐敗齊于林營。

translations.literal: Xi Gong thirtieth year, attacked defeated Qi at Lin Ying.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xi's thirtieth year, they attacked and defeated Qi at Lin Ying.
translations.text: In Duke Xi's thirtieth year, they attacked and defeated Qi at Lin Ying.

sentences.zh: 釐公卒，桓公立。

translations.literal: Xi Gong died, Huan Gong ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xi died, and Duke Huan ascended.
translations.text: Duke Xi died, and Duke Huan ascended.

sentences.zh: 桓公十一年卒，文公立。

translations.literal: Huan Gong eleventh year died, Wen Gong ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan died in his eleventh year, and Duke Wen ascended.
translations.text: Duke Huan died in his eleventh year, and Duke Wen ascended.

sentences.zh: 是歲，秦獻公卒。

translations.literal: This year, Qin Xian Gong died.
translations.idiomatic: In this year, Duke Xian of Qin died.
translations.text: In this year, Duke Xian of Qin died.

sentences.zh: 秦益彊。

translations.literal: Qin increasingly strong.
translations.idiomatic: Qin grew increasingly strong.
translations.text: Qin grew increasingly strong.

sentences.zh: 文公十九年，齊威王卒。

translations.literal: Wen Gong nineteenth year, Qi Wei Wang died.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Wen's nineteenth year, King Wei of Qi died.
translations.text: In Duke Wen's nineteenth year, King Wei of Qi died.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，蘇秦始來見，說文公。

translations.literal: Twenty-eighth year, Su Qin began came see, persuaded Wen Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, Su Qin first came to see him and persuaded Duke Wen.
translations.text: In the twenty-eighth year, Su Qin first came to see him and persuaded Duke Wen.

sentences.zh: 文公予車馬金帛以至趙，趙肅侯用之。

translations.literal: Wen Gong gave chariots horses gold silk to reach Zhao, Zhao Su Hou used him.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Wen gave him chariots, horses, gold, and silk to reach Zhao, and Marquis Su of Zhao used him.
translations.text: Duke Wen gave him chariots, horses, gold, and silk to reach Zhao, and Marquis Su of Zhao used him.

sentences.zh: 因約六國，為從長。

translations.literal: Therefore allied six states, became alliance leader.
translations.idiomatic: He therefore allied the six states and became the alliance leader.
translations.text: He therefore allied the six states and became the alliance leader.

sentences.zh: 秦惠王以其女為燕太子婦。

translations.literal: Qin Hui Wang with his daughter became Yan crown prince wife.
translations.idiomatic: King Hui of Qin made his daughter the wife of Yan's crown prince.
translations.text: King Hui of Qin made his daughter the wife of Yan's crown prince.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，文公卒，太子立，是為易王。

translations.literal: Twenty-ninth year, Wen Gong died, crown prince ascended, this was Yi Wang.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, Duke Wen died, and the crown prince ascended as King Yi.
translations.text: In the twenty-ninth year, Duke Wen died, and the crown prince ascended as King Yi.

sentences.zh: 易王初立，齊宣王因燕喪伐我，取十城；

translations.literal: Yi Wang first ascended, Qi Xuan Wang took advantage Yan mourning attacked us, took ten cities;
translations.idiomatic: When King Yi first ascended, King Xuan of Qi took advantage of Yan's mourning to attack us and took ten cities;
translations.text: When King Yi first ascended, King Xuan of Qi took advantage of Yan's mourning to attack us and took ten cities;

sentences.zh: 蘇秦說齊，使復歸燕十城。

translations.literal: Su Qin persuaded Qi, made again return Yan ten cities.
translations.idiomatic: Su Qin persuaded Qi to return the ten cities to Yan again.
translations.text: Su Qin persuaded Qi to return the ten cities to Yan again.

sentences.zh: 十年，燕君為王。

translations.literal: Tenth year, Yan lord became wang.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, the Yan lord became wang.
translations.text: In the tenth year, the Yan lord became wang.

sentences.zh: 蘇秦與燕文公夫人私通，懼誅，乃說王使齊為反閒，欲以亂齊。

translations.literal: Su Qin with Yan Wen Gong wife illicit relations, feared execution, then persuaded wang made Qi become reverse spies, desired with disorder Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Su Qin had illicit relations with Duke Wen of Yan's wife. Fearing execution, he then persuaded the wang to have Qi become reverse spies, desiring to cause disorder in Qi.
translations.text: Su Qin had illicit relations with Duke Wen of Yan's wife. Fearing execution, he then persuaded the wang to have Qi become reverse spies, desiring to cause disorder in Qi.

sentences.zh: 易王立十二年卒，子燕噲立。

translations.literal: Yi Wang ascended twelfth year died, son Yan Kuai ascended.
translations.idiomatic: King Yi ascended for twelve years and died, and his son Yan Kuai ascended.
translations.text: King Yi ascended for twelve years and died, and his son Yan Kuai ascended.

sentences.zh: 燕噲既立，齊人殺蘇秦。

translations.literal: Yan Kuai already ascended, Qi people killed Su Qin.
translations.idiomatic: After Yan Kuai ascended, the Qi people killed Su Qin.
translations.text: After Yan Kuai ascended, the Qi people killed Su Qin.

sentences.zh: 蘇秦之在燕，與其相子之為婚，而蘇代與子之交。

translations.literal: Su Qin when in Yan, with his prime minister Zi Zhi became marriage alliance, and Su Dai with Zi Zhi friendly.
translations.idiomatic: When Su Qin was in Yan, he became a marriage alliance with his prime minister Zi Zhi, and Su Dai was friendly with Zi Zhi.
translations.text: When Su Qin was in Yan, he became a marriage alliance with his prime minister Zi Zhi, and Su Dai was friendly with Zi Zhi.

sentences.zh: 及蘇秦死，而齊宣王復用蘇代。

translations.literal: When Su Qin died, and Qi Xuan Wang again used Su Dai.
translations.idiomatic: When Su Qin died, King Xuan of Qi again used Su Dai.
translations.text: When Su Qin died, King Xuan of Qi again used Su Dai.

sentences.zh: 燕噲三年，與楚、三晉攻秦，不勝而還。

translations.literal: Yan Kuai third year, with Chu, three Jin attacked Qin, not victorious and returned.
translations.idiomatic: In Yan Kuai's third year, together with Chu and the three Jin, they attacked Qin but were not victorious and returned.
translations.text: In Yan Kuai's third year, together with Chu and the three Jin, they attacked Qin but were not victorious and returned.

sentences.zh: 子之相燕，貴重，主斷。

translations.literal: Zi Zhi prime minister Yan, noble heavy, main decisions.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Zhi was prime minister of Yan, noble and heavy, making the main decisions.
translations.text: Zi Zhi was prime minister of Yan, noble and heavy, making the main decisions.

sentences.zh: 蘇代為齊使於燕，燕王問曰：「齊王奚如？」

translations.literal: Su Dai for Qi envoy to Yan, Yan Wang asked said: 'Qi Wang what like?'
translations.idiomatic: Su Dai was Qi's envoy to Yan. The Yan wang asked, saying: 'What is the Qi wang like?'
translations.text: Su Dai was Qi's envoy to Yan. The Yan wang asked, saying: 'What is the Qi wang like?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「必不霸。」

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Must not hegemony.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied, saying: 'He must not achieve hegemony.'
translations.text: He replied, saying: 'He must not achieve hegemony.'

sentences.zh: 燕王曰：「何也？」

translations.literal: Yan Wang said: 'Why?'
translations.idiomatic: The Yan wang said: 'Why?'
translations.text: The Yan wang said: 'Why?'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「不信其臣。」

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Not trust his ministers.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied, saying: 'He does not trust his ministers.'
translations.text: He replied, saying: 'He does not trust his ministers.'

sentences.zh: 蘇代欲以激燕王以尊子之也。

translations.literal: Su Dai desired with stimulate Yan Wang to honor Zi Zhi.
translations.idiomatic: Su Dai desired to stimulate the Yan wang to honor Zi Zhi.
translations.text: Su Dai desired to stimulate the Yan wang to honor Zi Zhi.

sentences.zh: 於是燕王大信子之。

translations.literal: Therefore Yan Wang greatly trusted Zi Zhi.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore the Yan wang greatly trusted Zi Zhi.
translations.text: Therefore the Yan wang greatly trusted Zi Zhi.

sentences.zh: 子之因遺蘇代百金，而聽其所使。

translations.literal: Zi Zhi therefore sent Su Dai hundred jin gold, and listened to what he instructed.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Zhi therefore sent Su Dai a hundred jin of gold and listened to what he instructed.
translations.text: Zi Zhi therefore sent Su Dai a hundred jin of gold and listened to what he instructed.

sentences.zh: 鹿毛壽謂燕王：「不如以國讓相子之。

translations.literal: Lu Mao Shou told Yan Wang: 'Not as good with state yield to prime minister Zi Zhi.
translations.idiomatic: Lu Mao Shou told the Yan wang: 'It would be better to yield the state to Prime Minister Zi Zhi.
translations.text: Lu Mao Shou told the Yan wang: 'It would be better to yield the state to Prime Minister Zi Zhi.

sentences.zh: 人之謂堯賢者，以其讓天下於許由，許由不受，有讓天下之名而實不失天下。

translations.literal: People call Yao worthy, because he yielded world to Xu You, Xu You not accept, had yield world name but actually not lose world.
translations.idiomatic: People call Yao worthy because he yielded the world to Xu You. Xu You did not accept it, so he had the name of yielding the world but actually did not lose the world.
translations.text: People call Yao worthy because he yielded the world to Xu You. Xu You did not accept it, so he had the name of yielding the world but actually did not lose the world.

sentences.zh: 今王以國讓於子之，子之必不敢受，是王與堯同行也。」

translations.literal: Now wang with state yield to Zi Zhi, Zi Zhi must dare not accept, this wang with Yao same conduct.'
translations.idiomatic: Now if the wang yields the state to Zi Zhi, Zi Zhi must not dare accept it. This means the wang will conduct himself the same as Yao.'
translations.text: Now if the wang yields the state to Zi Zhi, Zi Zhi must not dare accept it. This means the wang will conduct himself the same as Yao.'

sentences.zh: 燕王因屬國於子之，子之大重。

translations.literal: Yan Wang therefore entrusted state to Zi Zhi, Zi Zhi greatly heavy.
translations.idiomatic: The Yan wang therefore entrusted the state to Zi Zhi, and Zi Zhi became greatly heavy.
translations.text: The Yan wang therefore entrusted the state to Zi Zhi, and Zi Zhi became greatly heavy.

sentences.zh: 或曰：「禹薦益，已而以啟人為吏。

translations.literal: Someone said: 'Yu recommended Yi, already then with Qi people as officials.
translations.idiomatic: Someone said: 'Yu recommended Yi, and then made Qi's people officials.
translations.text: Someone said: 'Yu recommended Yi, and then made Qi's people officials.

sentences.zh: 及老，而以啟人為不足任乎天下，傳之於益。

translations.literal: When old, and with Qi people as not sufficient to bear world, transmitted to Yi.
translations.idiomatic: When he grew old, considering Qi's people insufficient to bear the world, he transmitted it to Yi.
translations.text: When he grew old, considering Qi's people insufficient to bear the world, he transmitted it to Yi.

sentences.zh: 已而啟與交黨攻益，奪之。

translations.literal: Already then Qi with allies attacked Yi, seized it.
translations.idiomatic: Then Qi, together with allies, attacked Yi and seized it.
translations.text: Then Qi, together with allies, attacked Yi and seized it.

sentences.zh: 天下謂禹名傳天下於益，已而實令啟自取之。

translations.literal: World called Yu name transmitted world to Yi, already then actually made Qi self take it.
translations.idiomatic: The world called Yu's name of transmitting the world to Yi, but actually he made Qi take it himself.
translations.text: The world called Yu's name of transmitting the world to Yi, but actually he made Qi take it himself.

sentences.zh: 今王言屬國於子之，而吏無非太子人者，是名屬子之而實太子用事也。」

translations.literal: Now wang speaks entrust state to Zi Zhi, but officials none not crown prince people, this name entrusts Zi Zhi but actually crown prince handles affairs.'
translations.idiomatic: Now the wang speaks of entrusting the state to Zi Zhi, but the officials are none other than the crown prince's people. This is nominally entrusting to Zi Zhi but actually the crown prince handles affairs.'
translations.text: Now the wang speaks of entrusting the state to Zi Zhi, but the officials are none other than the crown prince's people. This is nominally entrusting to Zi Zhi but actually the crown prince handles affairs.'

sentences.zh: 王因收印自三百石吏已上而效之子之。

translations.literal: Wang therefore collected seals from three hundred dan officials and above and presented them to Zi Zhi.
translations.idiomatic: The wang therefore collected the seals from officials of three hundred dan and above and presented them to Zi Zhi.
translations.text: The wang therefore collected the seals from officials of three hundred dan and above and presented them to Zi Zhi.

sentences.zh: 子之南面行王事，而噲老不聽政，顧為臣，國事皆決於子之。

translations.literal: Zi Zhi south face performed wang affairs, and Kuai old not listened to government, instead became minister, state affairs all decided by Zi Zhi.
translations.idiomatic: Zi Zhi faced south and performed the wang's affairs, while Kuai, grown old, did not listen to government, but instead became a minister. All state affairs were decided by Zi Zhi.
translations.text: Zi Zhi faced south and performed the wang's affairs, while Kuai, grown old, did not listen to government, but instead became a minister. All state affairs were decided by Zi Zhi.

sentences.zh: 三年，國大亂，百姓恫恐。

translations.literal: Third year, state greatly chaotic, common people fearful terrified.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, the state was greatly chaotic, and the common people were fearful.
translations.text: In the third year, the state was greatly chaotic, and the common people were fearful.

sentences.zh: 將軍市被與太子平謀，將攻子之。

translations.literal: General Shi Bei with crown prince Ping plotted, about to attack Zi Zhi.
translations.idiomatic: General Shi Bei plotted with Crown Prince Ping and was about to attack Zi Zhi.
translations.text: General Shi Bei plotted with Crown Prince Ping and was about to attack Zi Zhi.

sentences.zh: 諸將謂齊湣王曰：「因而赴之，破燕必矣。」

translations.literal: Various generals told Qi Min Wang said: 'Take advantage go to it, break Yan must.'
translations.idiomatic: The various generals told King Min of Qi, saying: 'Take advantage and go to it. Breaking Yan is certain.'
translations.text: The various generals told King Min of Qi, saying: 'Take advantage and go to it. Breaking Yan is certain.'

sentences.zh: 齊王因令人謂燕太子平曰：「寡人聞太子之義，將廢私而立公，飭君臣之義，明父子之位。

translations.literal: Qi Wang therefore made people tell Yan crown prince Ping said: 'Our orphaned person heard crown prince righteousness, will abolish private establish public, regulate lord minister righteousness, make clear father son position.
translations.idiomatic: The Qi wang therefore had people tell Yan's Crown Prince Ping, saying: 'Our orphaned person has heard of the crown prince's righteousness. He will abolish the private and establish the public, regulate the righteousness of lord and minister, make clear the positions of father and son.
translations.text: The Qi wang therefore had people tell Yan's Crown Prince Ping, saying: 'Our orphaned person has heard of the crown prince's righteousness. He will abolish the private and establish the public, regulate the righteousness of lord and minister, make clear the positions of father and son.

sentences.zh: 寡人之國小，不足以為先後。

translations.literal: Our orphaned person's state small, not sufficient to be first last.
translations.idiomatic: Our orphaned person's state is small and not sufficient to be first or last.
translations.text: Our orphaned person's state is small and not sufficient to be first or last.

sentences.zh: 雖然，則唯太子所以令之。」

translations.literal: Although thus, then only crown prince what command it.'
translations.idiomatic: Although this is so, then only whatever the crown prince commands.'
translations.text: Although this is so, then only whatever the crown prince commands.'

sentences.zh: 太子因要黨聚眾，將軍市被圍公宮，攻子之，不克。

translations.literal: Crown prince therefore summoned faction gathered multitude, general Shi Bei surrounded ducal palace, attacked Zi Zhi, not conquered.
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince therefore summoned his faction and gathered the multitude. General Shi Bei surrounded the ducal palace and attacked Zi Zhi, but did not conquer him.
translations.text: The crown prince therefore summoned his faction and gathered the multitude. General Shi Bei surrounded the ducal palace and attacked Zi Zhi, but did not conquer him.

sentences.zh: 將軍市被及百姓反攻太子平，將軍市被死，以徇。

translations.literal: General Shi Bei and common people counter attacked crown prince Ping, general Shi Bei died, to make example.
translations.idiomatic: General Shi Bei and the common people counter-attacked Crown Prince Ping. General Shi Bei died and was made an example.
translations.text: General Shi Bei and the common people counter-attacked Crown Prince Ping. General Shi Bei died and was made an example.

sentences.zh: 因搆難數月，死者數萬，眾人恫恐，百姓離志。

translations.literal: Therefore constructed difficulty several months, dead ones several ten thousand, multitude fearful terrified, common people separated intentions.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore they constructed difficulties for several months. Those who died numbered several ten thousand. The multitude was fearful and terrified, and the common people had separated intentions.
translations.text: Therefore they constructed difficulties for several months. Those who died numbered several ten thousand. The multitude was fearful and terrified, and the common people had separated intentions.

sentences.zh: 孟軻謂齊王曰：「今伐燕，此文、武之時，不可失也。」

translations.literal: Meng Ke told Qi Wang said: 'Now attack Yan, this Wen, Wu time, cannot lose.'
translations.idiomatic: Meng Ke told the Qi wang, saying: 'Now to attack Yan—this is Wen and Wu's time. It cannot be lost.'
translations.text: Meng Ke told the Qi wang, saying: 'Now to attack Yan—this is Wen and Wu's time. It cannot be lost.'

sentences.zh: 王因令章子將五都之兵，以因北地之眾以伐燕。

translations.literal: Wang therefore commanded Zhang Zi led five capitals troops, with took advantage north land multitude to attack Yan.
translations.idiomatic: The wang therefore commanded Zhang Zi to lead the troops of five capitals, taking advantage of the northern lands' multitude to attack Yan.
translations.text: The wang therefore commanded Zhang Zi to lead the troops of five capitals, taking advantage of the northern lands' multitude to attack Yan.

sentences.zh: 士卒不戰，城門不閉，燕君噲死，齊大勝。

translations.literal: Soldiers not fight, city gates not closed, Yan lord Kuai died, Qi greatly victorious.
translations.idiomatic: The soldiers did not fight, the city gates were not closed, Yan lord Kuai died, and Qi was greatly victorious.
translations.text: The soldiers did not fight, the city gates were not closed, Yan lord Kuai died, and Qi was greatly victorious.

sentences.zh: 燕子之亡二年，而燕人共立太子平，是為燕昭王。

translations.literal: Yan Zi Zhi perished second year, and Yan people together established crown prince Ping, this was Yan Zhao Wang.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year after Yan Zi Zhi perished, the Yan people together established Crown Prince Ping, who became King Zhao of Yan.
translations.text: In the second year after Yan Zi Zhi perished, the Yan people together established Crown Prince Ping, who became King Zhao of Yan.

sentences.zh: 燕昭王於破燕之後即位，卑身厚幣以招賢者。

translations.literal: Yan Zhao Wang after broken Yan then ascended, lowered body thick currency to attract worthy people.
translations.idiomatic: King Zhao of Yan ascended after Yan was broken, lowered himself and offered thick gifts to attract worthy people.
translations.text: King Zhao of Yan ascended after Yan was broken, lowered himself and offered thick gifts to attract worthy people.

sentences.zh: 謂郭隗曰：「齊因孤之國亂而襲破燕，孤極知燕小力少，不足以報。

translations.literal: Told Guo Wei said: 'Qi took advantage orphaned person's state chaos and raided broke Yan, orphaned person extremely knows Yan small strength few, not sufficient to repay.
translations.idiomatic: He told Guo Wei, saying: 'Qi took advantage of our orphaned person's state chaos and raided to break Yan. Our orphaned person extremely knows Yan is small with few strengths, not sufficient to repay.
translations.text: He told Guo Wei, saying: 'Qi took advantage of our orphaned person's state chaos and raided to break Yan. Our orphaned person extremely knows Yan is small with few strengths, not sufficient to repay.

sentences.zh: 然誠得賢士以共國，以雪先王之恥，孤之願也。

translations.literal: However truly obtain worthy scholars to share state, to wash away former wang shame, orphaned person's wish.
translations.idiomatic: However, truly obtaining worthy scholars to share the state, to wash away the former wang's shame—that is our orphaned person's wish.
translations.text: However, truly obtaining worthy scholars to share the state, to wash away the former wang's shame—that is our orphaned person's wish.

sentences.zh: 先生視可者，得身事之。」

translations.literal: Mister look at suitable ones, obtain personally serve them.'
translations.idiomatic: Mister, look at the suitable ones and obtain to personally serve them.'
translations.text: Mister, look at the suitable ones and obtain to personally serve them.'

sentences.zh: 郭隗曰：「王必欲致士，先從隗始。

translations.literal: Guo Wei said: 'Wang must desire bring scholars, first from Wei start.
translations.idiomatic: Guo Wei said: 'If the wang must desire to bring scholars, first start from Wei.
translations.text: Guo Wei said: 'If the wang must desire to bring scholars, first start from Wei.

sentences.zh: 況賢於隗者，豈遠千里哉！」

translations.literal: Moreover worthy than Wei, how far thousand li!'
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, those more worthy than Wei, how would they be far a thousand li!'
translations.text: Moreover, those more worthy than Wei, how would they be far a thousand li!'

sentences.zh: 於是昭王為隗改筑宮而師事之。

translations.literal: Therefore Zhao Wang for Wei rebuilt palace and master served him.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore King Zhao rebuilt a palace for Wei and served him as master.
translations.text: Therefore King Zhao rebuilt a palace for Wei and served him as master.

sentences.zh: 樂毅自魏往，鄒衍自齊往，劇辛自趙往，士爭趨燕。

translations.literal: Yue Yi from Wei went, Zou Yan from Qi went, Ju Xin from Zhao went, scholars contended rushed Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Yue Yi went from Wei, Zou Yan went from Qi, Ju Xin went from Zhao, and scholars contended to rush to Yan.
translations.text: Yue Yi went from Wei, Zou Yan went from Qi, Ju Xin went from Zhao, and scholars contended to rush to Yan.

sentences.zh: 燕王噲死問孤，與百姓同甘苦。

translations.literal: Yan Wang Kuai died asked orphaned person, with common people same sweet bitter.
translations.idiomatic: When Yan Wang Kuai died, he asked the orphaned person, sharing sweet and bitter with the common people.
translations.text: When Yan Wang Kuai died, he asked the orphaned person, sharing sweet and bitter with the common people.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，燕國殷富，士卒樂軼輕戰，於是遂以樂毅為上將軍，與秦、楚、三晉合謀以伐齊。

translations.literal: Twenty-eighth year, Yan state abundant rich, soldiers happy exceeded light war, therefore then made Yue Yi chief general, with Qin, Chu, three Jin united plotted to attack Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, the Yan state was abundantly rich, the soldiers were happy and exceeded in light warfare. Therefore they made Yue Yi the chief general and united with Qin, Chu, and the three Jin to plot attacking Qi.
translations.text: In the twenty-eighth year, the Yan state was abundantly rich, the soldiers were happy and exceeded in light warfare. Therefore they made Yue Yi the chief general and united with Qin, Chu, and the three Jin to plot attacking Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊兵敗，湣王出亡於外。

translations.literal: Qi troops defeated, Min Wang fled outside.
translations.idiomatic: The Qi troops were defeated, and King Min fled outside.
translations.text: The Qi troops were defeated, and King Min fled outside.

sentences.zh: 燕兵獨追北，入至臨淄，盡取齊寶，燒其宮室宗廟。

translations.literal: Yan troops alone pursued north, entered to Lin Zi, completely took Qi treasures, burned their palaces ancestral temples.
translations.idiomatic: The Yan troops alone pursued northward, entered to Lin Zi, completely took Qi's treasures, and burned their palaces and ancestral temples.
translations.text: The Yan troops alone pursued northward, entered to Lin Zi, completely took Qi's treasures, and burned their palaces and ancestral temples.

sentences.zh: 齊城之不下者，獨唯聊、莒、即墨，其餘皆屬燕，六歲。

translations.literal: Qi cities what not fell, only merely Liao, Ju, Ji Mo, remainder all belonged Yan, six years.
translations.idiomatic: The Qi cities that did not fall were only Liao, Ju, and Ji Mo. The remainder all belonged to Yan for six years.
translations.text: The Qi cities that did not fall were only Liao, Ju, and Ji Mo. The remainder all belonged to Yan for six years.

sentences.zh: 武成王七年，齊田單伐我，拔中陽。

translations.literal: Wu Cheng Wang seventh year, Qi Tian Dan attacked us, captured Zhong Yang.
translations.idiomatic: In King Wu Cheng's seventh year, Qi's Tian Dan attacked us and captured Zhong Yang.
translations.text: In King Wu Cheng's seventh year, Qi's Tian Dan attacked us and captured Zhong Yang.

sentences.zh: 十三年，秦敗趙於長平四十餘萬。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, Qin defeated Zhao at Chang Ping forty remaining ten thousand.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Qin defeated Zhao at Chang Ping, forty-some ten thousand.
translations.text: In the thirteenth year, Qin defeated Zhao at Chang Ping, forty-some ten thousand.

sentences.zh: 十四年，武成王卒，子孝王立。

translations.literal: Fourteenth year, Wu Cheng Wang died, son Xiao Wang ascended.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, King Wu Cheng died, and his son King Xiao ascended.
translations.text: In the fourteenth year, King Wu Cheng died, and his son King Xiao ascended.

sentences.zh: 孝王元年，秦圍邯鄲者解去。

translations.literal: Xiao Wang first year, Qin surrounded Han Dan ones dispersed left.
translations.idiomatic: In King Xiao's first year, those Qin who surrounded Han Dan dispersed and left.
translations.text: In King Xiao's first year, those Qin who surrounded Han Dan dispersed and left.

sentences.zh: 三年卒，子今王喜立。

translations.literal: Third year died, son present wang Xi ascended.
translations.idiomatic: He died in the third year, and his son the present wang Xi ascended.
translations.text: He died in the third year, and his son the present wang Xi ascended.

sentences.zh: 今王喜四年，秦昭王卒。

translations.literal: Present wang Xi fourth year, Qin Zhao Wang died.
translations.idiomatic: In the present wang Xi's fourth year, King Zhao of Qin died.
translations.text: In the present wang Xi's fourth year, King Zhao of Qin died.

sentences.zh: 燕王命相栗腹約歡趙，以五百金為趙王酒。

translations.literal: Yan Wang commanded prime minister Li Fu allied friendly Zhao, with five hundred jin made Zhao Wang wine.
translations.idiomatic: The Yan wang commanded Prime Minister Li Fu to make friendly alliances with Zhao, using five hundred jin to make wine for the Zhao wang.
translations.text: The Yan wang commanded Prime Minister Li Fu to make friendly alliances with Zhao, using five hundred jin to make wine for the Zhao wang.

sentences.zh: 還報燕王曰：「趙王壯者皆死長平，其孤未壯，可伐也。」

translations.literal: Returned reported Yan Wang said: 'Zhao Wang strong ones all died Chang Ping, their orphans not yet strong, may attack.'
translations.idiomatic: He returned and reported to the Yan wang, saying: 'Zhao wang's strong ones all died at Chang Ping. Their orphans are not yet strong. They may be attacked.'
translations.text: He returned and reported to the Yan wang, saying: 'Zhao wang's strong ones all died at Chang Ping. Their orphans are not yet strong. They may be attacked.'

sentences.zh: 王召昌國君樂閒問之。

translations.literal: Wang summoned Chang Guo Jun Yue Xian asked it.
translations.idiomatic: The wang summoned Lord Chang Guo Yue Xian and asked him.
translations.text: The wang summoned Lord Chang Guo Yue Xian and asked him.

sentences.zh: 對曰：「趙四戰之國，其民習兵，不可伐。」

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Zhao four battle country, its people accustomed weapons, cannot attack.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied, saying: 'Zhao is a country of four battles. Its people are accustomed to weapons. It cannot be attacked.'
translations.text: He replied, saying: 'Zhao is a country of four battles. Its people are accustomed to weapons. It cannot be attacked.'

sentences.zh: 王曰：「吾以五而伐一。」

translations.literal: Wang said: 'I with five attack one.'
translations.idiomatic: The wang said: 'I will attack one with five.'
translations.text: The wang said: 'I will attack one with five.'

sentences.zh: 對曰：「不可。」

translations.literal: Replied said: 'Not possible.'
translations.idiomatic: He replied, saying: 'Not possible.'
translations.text: He replied, saying: 'Not possible.'

sentences.zh: 燕王怒，群臣皆以為可。

translations.literal: Yan Wang angered, multitude ministers all considered possible.
translations.idiomatic: The Yan wang became angry, and all the ministers considered it possible.
translations.text: The Yan wang became angry, and all the ministers considered it possible.

sentences.zh: 卒起二軍，車二千乘，栗腹將而攻鄗，卿秦攻代。

translations.literal: Finally raised two armies, chariots two thousand ascended, Li Fu led attacked Hao, minister Qin attacked Dai.
translations.idiomatic: Finally they raised two armies with two thousand chariots. Li Fu led and attacked Hao, Minister Qin attacked Dai.
translations.text: Finally they raised two armies with two thousand chariots. Li Fu led and attacked Hao, Minister Qin attacked Dai.

sentences.zh: 唯獨大夫將渠謂燕王曰：「與人通關約交，以五百金飲人之王，使者報而反攻之，不祥，兵無成功。」

translations.literal: Only alone grand officer Jiang Qu told Yan Wang said: 'With people through border allied friendly, with five hundred jin drank person's wang, envoy reported then instead attacked it, not auspicious, troops without success.'
translations.idiomatic: Only Grand Officer Jiang Qu alone told the Yan wang, saying: 'With people through the border we allied friendly, using five hundred jin to drink the person's wang. The envoy reported and then we instead attack it—this is not auspicious. The troops will have no success.'
translations.text: Only Grand Officer Jiang Qu alone told the Yan wang, saying: 'With people through the border we allied friendly, using five hundred jin to drink the person's wang. The envoy reported and then we instead attack it—this is not auspicious. The troops will have no success.'

sentences.zh: 燕王不聽，自將偏軍隨之。

translations.literal: Yan Wang not listen, personally led flank army followed it.
translations.idiomatic: The Yan wang did not listen and personally led a flank army to follow it.
translations.text: The Yan wang did not listen and personally led a flank army to follow it.

sentences.zh: 將渠引燕王綬止之曰：「王必無自往，往無成功。」

translations.literal: Jiang Qu pulled Yan Wang ribbon stopped him said: 'Wang must not personally go, go without success.'
translations.idiomatic: Jiang Qu pulled the Yan wang's ribbon to stop him, saying: 'The wang must not go personally. Going will have no success.'
translations.text: Jiang Qu pulled the Yan wang's ribbon to stop him, saying: 'The wang must not go personally. Going will have no success.'

sentences.zh: 王蹵之以足。

translations.literal: Wang kicked him with foot.
translations.idiomatic: The wang kicked him with his foot.
translations.text: The wang kicked him with his foot.

sentences.zh: 將渠泣曰：「臣非以自為，為王也！」

translations.literal: Jiang Qu wept said: 'Minister not with self for, for wang!'
translations.idiomatic: Jiang Qu wept and said: 'The minister is not doing this for himself, but for the wang!'
translations.text: Jiang Qu wept and said: 'The minister is not doing this for himself, but for the wang!'

sentences.zh: 燕軍至宋子，趙使廉頗將，擊破栗腹於鄗。

translations.literal: Yan army arrived Song Zi, Zhao made Lian Po led, struck broke Li Fu at Hao.
translations.idiomatic: The Yan army arrived at Song Zi. Zhao had Lian Po lead and struck to break Li Fu at Hao.
translations.text: The Yan army arrived at Song Zi. Zhao had Lian Po lead and struck to break Li Fu at Hao.

sentences.zh: ［樂乘］破卿秦（樂乘）於代。

translations.literal: [Yue Cheng] broke minister Qin [Yue Cheng] at Dai.
translations.idiomatic: [Yue Cheng] broke Minister Qin [Yue Cheng] at Dai.
translations.text: [Yue Cheng] broke Minister Qin [Yue Cheng] at Dai.

sentences.zh: 樂閒奔趙。

translations.literal: Yue Xian fled Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: Yue Xian fled to Zhao.
translations.text: Yue Xian fled to Zhao.

sentences.zh: 廉頗逐之五百餘里，圍其國。

translations.literal: Lian Po pursued them five hundred remaining li, surrounded their state.
translations.idiomatic: Lian Po pursued them for five hundred-some li and surrounded their state.
translations.text: Lian Po pursued them for five hundred-some li and surrounded their state.

sentences.zh: 燕人請和，趙人不許，必令將渠處和。

translations.literal: Yan people requested peace, Zhao people not permitted, must command Jiang Qu arrange peace.
translations.idiomatic: The Yan people requested peace, but the Zhao people did not permit it. They must command Jiang Qu to arrange peace.
translations.text: The Yan people requested peace, but the Zhao people did not permit it. They must command Jiang Qu to arrange peace.

sentences.zh: 燕相將渠以處和。

translations.literal: Yan prime minister Jiang Qu with arranged peace.
translations.idiomatic: Yan prime minister Jiang Qu arranged peace.
translations.text: Yan prime minister Jiang Qu arranged peace.

sentences.zh: 趙聽將渠，解燕圍。

translations.literal: Zhao listened Jiang Qu, dispersed Yan siege.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao listened to Jiang Qu and dispersed the Yan siege.
translations.text: Zhao listened to Jiang Qu and dispersed the Yan siege.

sentences.zh: 六年，秦滅東（西）周，置三川郡。

translations.literal: Sixth year, Qin extinguished east (west) Zhou, established San Chuan commandery.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Qin extinguished East (West) Zhou and established the San Chuan commandery.
translations.text: In the sixth year, Qin extinguished East (West) Zhou and established the San Chuan commandery.

sentences.zh: 七年，秦拔趙榆次三十七城，秦置大原郡。

translations.literal: Seventh year, Qin captured Zhao Yu Ci thirty-seven cities, Qin established Tai Yuan commandery.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, Qin captured Zhao's Yu Ci thirty-seven cities, and Qin established the Tai Yuan commandery.
translations.text: In the seventh year, Qin captured Zhao's Yu Ci thirty-seven cities, and Qin established the Tai Yuan commandery.

sentences.zh: 九年，秦王政初即位。

translations.literal: Ninth year, Qin Wang Zheng first ascended throne.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Qin Wang Zheng first ascended the throne.
translations.text: In the ninth year, Qin Wang Zheng first ascended the throne.

sentences.zh: 十年，趙使廉頗將攻繁陽，拔之。

translations.literal: Tenth year, Zhao made Lian Po led attacked Fan Yang, captured it.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, Zhao had Lian Po lead and attack Fan Yang, capturing it.
translations.text: In the tenth year, Zhao had Lian Po lead and attack Fan Yang, capturing it.

sentences.zh: 趙孝成王卒，悼襄王立。

translations.literal: Zhao Xiao Cheng Wang died, Dao Xiang Wang ascended.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao King Xiao Cheng died, and King Dao Xiang ascended.
translations.text: Zhao King Xiao Cheng died, and King Dao Xiang ascended.

sentences.zh: 使樂乘代廉頗，廉頗不聽，攻樂乘，樂乘走，廉頗奔大梁。

translations.literal: Made Yue Cheng replace Lian Po, Lian Po not listen, attacked Yue Cheng, Yue Cheng fled, Lian Po fled Dai Liang.
translations.idiomatic: They made Yue Cheng replace Lian Po. Lian Po did not listen and attacked Yue Cheng. Yue Cheng fled, and Lian Po fled to Dai Liang.
translations.text: They made Yue Cheng replace Lian Po. Lian Po did not listen and attacked Yue Cheng. Yue Cheng fled, and Lian Po fled to Dai Liang.

sentences.zh: 十二年，趙使李牧攻燕，拔武遂、方城。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, Zhao made Li Mu attack Yan, captured Wu Sui, Fang Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Zhao had Li Mu attack Yan and captured Wu Sui and Fang Cheng.
translations.text: In the twelfth year, Zhao had Li Mu attack Yan and captured Wu Sui and Fang Cheng.

sentences.zh: 劇辛故居趙，與龐煖善，已而亡走燕。

translations.literal: Ju Xin originally resided Zhao, with Pang Juan friendly, already then fled went Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Ju Xin originally resided in Zhao and was friendly with Pang Juan. Then he fled and went to Yan.
translations.text: Ju Xin originally resided in Zhao and was friendly with Pang Juan. Then he fled and went to Yan.

sentences.zh: 燕見趙數困于秦，而廉頗去，令龐煖將也，欲因趙獘攻之。

translations.literal: Yan saw Zhao several times troubled by Qin, and Lian Po gone, commanded Pang Juan led, desired took advantage Zhao exhausted attacked it.
translations.idiomatic: Yan saw that Zhao was several times troubled by Qin, and Lian Po was gone. They commanded Pang Juan to lead and desired to take advantage of Zhao's exhaustion to attack it.
translations.text: Yan saw that Zhao was several times troubled by Qin, and Lian Po was gone. They commanded Pang Juan to lead and desired to take advantage of Zhao's exhaustion to attack it.

sentences.zh: 問劇辛，辛曰：「龐煖易與耳。」

translations.literal: Asked Ju Xin, Xin said: 'Pang Juan easy with ear.'
translations.idiomatic: They asked Ju Xin, and Xin said: 'Pang Juan is easy to deal with.'
translations.text: They asked Ju Xin, and Xin said: 'Pang Juan is easy to deal with.'

sentences.zh: 燕使劇辛將擊趙，趙使龐煖擊之，取燕軍二萬，殺劇辛。

translations.literal: Yan made Ju Xin led struck Zhao, Zhao made Pang Juan struck it, took Yan army twenty thousand, killed Ju Xin.
translations.idiomatic: Yan had Ju Xin lead and strike Zhao. Zhao had Pang Juan strike them, taking twenty thousand Yan troops and killing Ju Xin.
translations.text: Yan had Ju Xin lead and strike Zhao. Zhao had Pang Juan strike them, taking twenty thousand Yan troops and killing Ju Xin.

sentences.zh: 秦拔魏二十城，置東郡。

translations.literal: Qin captured Wei twenty cities, established Dong commandery.
translations.idiomatic: Qin captured Wei's twenty cities and established the Dong commandery.
translations.text: Qin captured Wei's twenty cities and established the Dong commandery.

sentences.zh: 十九年，秦拔趙之鄴九城。

translations.literal: Nineteenth year, Qin captured Zhao's Ye nine cities.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, Qin captured Zhao's Ye nine cities.
translations.text: In the nineteenth year, Qin captured Zhao's Ye nine cities.

sentences.zh: 趙悼襄王卒。

translations.literal: Zhao Dao Xiang Wang died.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao King Dao Xiang died.
translations.text: Zhao King Dao Xiang died.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，太子丹質於秦，亡歸燕。

translations.literal: Twenty-third year, crown prince Dan hostage at Qin, fled returned Yan.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, Crown Prince Dan was hostage in Qin and fled back to Yan.
translations.text: In the twenty-third year, Crown Prince Dan was hostage in Qin and fled back to Yan.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，秦虜滅韓王安，置潁川郡。

translations.literal: Twenty-fifth year, Qin captured extinguished Han Wang An, established Ying Chuan commandery.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, Qin captured and extinguished King An of Han, establishing the Ying Chuan commandery.
translations.text: In the twenty-fifth year, Qin captured and extinguished King An of Han, establishing the Ying Chuan commandery.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，秦虜趙王遷，滅趙。

translations.literal: Twenty-seventh year, Qin captured Zhao Wang Qian, extinguished Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, Qin captured King Qian of Zhao and extinguished Zhao.
translations.text: In the twenty-seventh year, Qin captured King Qian of Zhao and extinguished Zhao.

sentences.zh: 趙公子嘉自立為代王。

translations.literal: Zhao prince Jia self established as Dai Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao prince Jia self-established as King of Dai.
translations.text: Zhao prince Jia self-established as King of Dai.

sentences.zh: 燕見秦且滅六國，秦兵臨易水，禍且至燕。

translations.literal: Yan saw Qin about to extinguish six states, Qin troops approached Yi Shui, calamity about to reach Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Yan saw that Qin was about to extinguish the six states, with Qin troops approaching Yi Shui. Calamity was about to reach Yan.
translations.text: Yan saw that Qin was about to extinguish the six states, with Qin troops approaching Yi Shui. Calamity was about to reach Yan.

sentences.zh: 太子丹陰養壯士二十人，使荊軻獻督亢地圖於秦，因襲刺秦王。

translations.literal: Crown prince Dan secretly raised brave men twenty people, made Jing Ke offer Du Kang land map to Qin, took advantage attacked stabbed Qin Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Crown Prince Dan secretly raised twenty brave men and had Jing Ke offer a map of Du Kang land to Qin. He took advantage to attack and stab the Qin wang.
translations.text: Crown Prince Dan secretly raised twenty brave men and had Jing Ke offer a map of Du Kang land to Qin. He took advantage to attack and stab the Qin wang.

sentences.zh: 秦王覺，殺軻，使將軍王翦擊燕。

translations.literal: Qin Wang aware, killed Ke, made general Wang Jian strike Yan.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin wang became aware, killed Ke, and had General Wang Jian strike Yan.
translations.text: The Qin wang became aware, killed Ke, and had General Wang Jian strike Yan.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，秦攻拔我薊，燕王亡，徙居遼東，斬丹以獻秦。

translations.literal: Twenty-ninth year, Qin attacked captured our Ji, Yan Wang fled, moved resided Liao Dong, beheaded Dan to offer Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, Qin attacked and captured our Ji. The Yan wang fled and moved to reside in Liao Dong. They beheaded Dan to offer to Qin.
translations.text: In the twenty-ninth year, Qin attacked and captured our Ji. The Yan wang fled and moved to reside in Liao Dong. They beheaded Dan to offer to Qin.

sentences.zh: 三十年，秦滅魏。

translations.literal: Thirtieth year, Qin extinguished Wei.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirtieth year, Qin extinguished Wei.
translations.text: In the thirtieth year, Qin extinguished Wei.

sentences.zh: 三十三年，秦拔遼東，虜燕王喜，卒滅燕。

translations.literal: Thirty-third year, Qin captured Liao Dong, captured Yan Wang Xi, finally extinguished Yan.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-third year, Qin captured Liao Dong, captured King Xi of Yan, and finally extinguished Yan.
translations.text: In the thirty-third year, Qin captured Liao Dong, captured King Xi of Yan, and finally extinguished Yan.

sentences.zh: 是歲，秦將王賁亦虜代王嘉。

translations.literal: This year, Qin general Wang Ben also captured Dai Wang Jia.
translations.idiomatic: In this year, Qin general Wang Ben also captured King Jia of Dai.
translations.text: In this year, Qin general Wang Ben also captured King Jia of Dai.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：召公奭可謂仁矣！

translations.literal: Grand Historian said: Duke Shao Shi can be called humane!
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian said: Duke Shao Shi can truly be called humane!
translations.text: The Grand Historian said: Duke Shao Shi can truly be called humane!

sentences.zh: 笆棠且思之，況其人乎？

translations.literal: Sweet棠 moreover thought of it, moreover its person?
translations.idiomatic: The people even think of the crabapple tree—what of the man himself?
translations.text: The people even think of the crabapple tree—what of the man himself?

sentences.zh: 燕（北）［外］迫蠻貉，內措齊、晉，崎嶇彊國之閒，最為弱小，幾滅者數矣。

translations.literal: Yan (north) [outer] pressed Man Mo, inner placed Qi, Jin, rugged strong states between, most weak small, nearly extinguished several times.
translations.idiomatic: Yan was pressed by barbarians and Mo on the outside, placed between Qi and Jin on the inside, rugged between strong states, and was the weakest and smallest. It nearly perished several times.
translations.text: Yan was pressed by barbarians and Mo on the outside, placed between Qi and Jin on the inside, rugged between strong states, and was the weakest and smallest. It nearly perished several times.

sentences.zh: 然社稷血食者八九百歲，於姬姓獨後亡，豈非召公之烈邪！

translations.literal: However altars sacrifices eight nine hundred years, among Ji surname alone last perished, how not Duke Shao's achievement!
translations.idiomatic: However, the altars and sacrifices lasted eight or nine hundred years. Among the Ji surname states, it alone perished last. How is this not Duke Shao's achievement!
translations.text: However, the altars and sacrifices lasted eight or nine hundred years. Among the Ji surname states, it alone perished last. How is this not Duke Shao's achievement!
